value.halfverse: I will tell of all your marvelous works.
value.verse: I will give thanks to you, O LORD, with my whole heart; *

value.halfverse: I will sing to your Name, O Most High.
value.verse: I will be glad and rejoice in you; *

value.halfverse: they will stumble and perish at your presence.
value.verse: When my enemies are driven back, *
For you have maintained my right and my cause; *
value.halfverse: you sit upon your throne judging right.

value.verse: You have rebuked the ungodly and destroyed the wicked; *
value.halfverse: you have blotted out their name for ever and ever.
their cities plowed under, the memory of them perished;
value.verse: As for the enemy, they are finished, in perpetual ruin, *
But the LORD is enthroned for ever; *
value.halfverse: he has set up this throne for judgment.
he judges the peoples with equity.
value.verse: It is he who rules the world with righteousness; *

value.halfverse: a refuge in time of trouble.
value.verse: The LORD will be a refuge for the oppressed, *

value.halfverse: for you never forsake those who seek you, O LORD.
value.verse: Those who know your Name will put their trust in you, *

value.halfverse: proclaim to the peoples the things he has done.
value.verse: Sing praise to the LORD who dwells in Zion; *

value.halfverse: he will not forget the cry of the afflicted.
value.verse: The Avenger of blood will remember them; *
Have pity on me, O LORD; *
value.halfverse:
see the misery I suffer from those who hate me,
 O you who lift me up from the gate of death;

value.verse:
So that I may tell of all your praises
and rejoice in your salvation *
value.halfverse: in the gates of the city of Zion.

value.verse: The ungodly have fallen into the pit they dug, *
value.halfverse: and in the snare they set is their own foot caught.
the wicked are trapped in the works of their own hands.
value.verse: The LORD is known by his acts of justice; *

value.halfverse: and also all the people that forget God.
value.verse: The wicked shall be given over to the grave, *

value.halfverse: and the hope of the poor shall not perish for ever.
value.verse: For the needy shall not always be forgotten, *

value.halfverse: let them be judged before you.
value.verse: Rise up, O LORD, let not the ungodly have the upper hand; *

value.halfverse: let the ungodly know they are but mortal.
value.verse: Put fear upon them, O LORD; *
